The AMC and GME stocks are on a tear, they have gained great attractions from the investors.

Under the hood, you can find that these stocks are bought by someone who are overwhelmingly doing the same thing as people who are working as hard as they can to make effort to make their life better.

I think what I want is for someone to know me. Really know me. Know me better than anyone else and maybe even me. Isn‚Äôt that why we commit to another? It‚Äôs not for sex. If it were for sex, we wouldn‚Äôt marry one person. We‚Äôd just keep finding new partners. We commit for many reasons, I know, but the more I think about it, the more I think long-term relationships are for getting to know someone. I want someone to know me, really know me, almost like that person could get into my head.

What would that feel like? To have access, to know what it‚Äôs like in someone else‚Äôs head. To rely on someone else, have him rely on you. That‚Äôs not a biological connection like the one between parents and children. This kind of relationship would be chosen. It would be something cooler, harder to achieve than one built on biology and shared genetics. I think that‚Äôs it. Maybe that‚Äôs how we know when a relationship is real. When someone else previously unconnected to us knows us in a way we never thought or believed possible.‚Äù ‚Äï Iain Reid, I‚Äôm Thinking of Ending Things

BTW, there was a brief discussion over the authoritarian Benito Mussolini in the movie. The female protagnist was sharing her poem with her boyfriend in the car, she seems sort of far away with a pale face, telling her boyfriend she was just having some vague stuff inside her head. As these two are on their trip to the boy‚Äôs parents‚Äô home, the girl feels like something effable as this trip is just like Mussolini‚Äôs train, it‚Äôs always on time.

In fact, in the WWI, there is a saying goes like this:

it is Mussolini who made the train runs on time.

Yet, these nice stories are just make-ups, the railway system was improved before he came to power. That is very true.
